required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Safety and Antiviral Effect of ABT-450/Ritonavir and ABT-530 Coadministered With and Without Ribavirin in Adults With Genotype 3 Hepatitis C (HCV) Infection
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Pilot Study to Evaluate the Antiviral Activity, Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of ABT-450 With Ritonavir (ABT-450/r) Dosed in Combination With ABT-530, With and Without Ribavirin (RBV) in Treatment-Naïve Subjects With Genotype 3 Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Infection

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and antiviral effect of multiple doses of ABT-450/r and ABT-530 coadministered with and without Ribavirin in adults with genotype 3 HCV infection.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: The percentage of subjects who achieve 12-week sustained virologic response (SVR12) in each treatment arm
primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after last dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: Hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid less than the lower limit of quantification

secondary_outcome.measure: The percentage of subjects who achieve 24-week sustained virologic response (SVR24) in each treatment arm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid less than the lower limit of quantification

secondary_outcome.measure: The percentage of subjects with virologic failure during treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with quantifiable hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid throughout the entire treatment period, confirmed quantifiable hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid after previously having unquantifiable hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid, or a confirmed increase of at least one log10 in hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid during treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: The percentage of subjects with Post-Treatment relapse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with confirmed quantifiable hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid among subjects with unquantifiable hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid at the end of treatment

arm_group.description: ABT-450/r and ABT-530 co-administered with ribavirin (RBV) for 12 weeks
ABT-450/r and ABT-530 co-administered for 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female (of non-child bearing potential) between 18 and 70 years of age with Body Mass Index ≥18 to <38 kg/m2.
- Chronic HCV genotype 3 infection prior to study enrollment and has never received antiviral treatment for HCV.
- Subject has plasma HCV RNA level > 10,000 IU/mL at Screening.
- Sexually active males must be sterile, have male partners only, or agree to use two effective forms of birth control for 7 months after stopping study drug.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of severe, life-threatening or other significant sensitivity to any drug.
- Positive test result for Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) or anti-Human Immunodeficiency virus antibody (HIV Ab).
- Prior therapy for the treatment of HCV.
- Any current or past clinical evidence of cirrhosis.
- Any cause of liver disease other than chronic HCV-infection.
- HCV genotype co-infection with any other HCV genotype.
- Use of contraindicated medications within 2 weeks or 10 half-lives of dosing.
